question: When does the next class start?
answer: Upcoming classes will be updated periodically on our website

question: Do I need to bring a laptop?
answer: Yes, you should have your own laptop to attend online classes

question: What is your admissions process?
answer: Once you sign up from the website, an admissions counselor will contact you on your registered mobile. Before you are admitted, we’ll sit down for an informal discussion on what motivates you, education background, work experience and general awareness in the IT field. From our experiences, we found many students who didn’t have any core programming skills to be able to learn and transition into professionals in the field

question: I do not have a computer science background. Can I still take this course?
answer: Our program is designed for those new to software industry. You will start from basic concepts to learning key programming fundamentals. There will be homework and in-class projects so that you get a chance to apply what you learn and trying things for yourself. Although we do not assume any prior programming knowledge, it would be helpful for you to get a head-start by checking our e-learning section.

question: Will I get a job after completing this course?
answer: Your skills will be in high demand, and you’re future will be bright, but like most things in life, your prospective employment in the industry depends on how hard you work. If you consistently apply throughout the 12-week job program, then your chances look really good. You will also need to be well-prepared for your interviews. The good news is that we will be with you every step of the way. We don’t just teach you to code and build project, we also work with you on your resume, help you prepare for interviews, and connect you with job opportunities. We maintain relationships with a vast network of companies in the software development world as well as with our alumni base, which provides our students a variety of potential employment opportunities.
